abstract: Contract workers for Metropolitan Transportation Authority under North Carolina contractor Global Contact Services are pushing for higher wages and improved working conditions; workers, who voted in 2014 to join Transport Workers Union Local 100, say wages of $9 to $11 per hour, below proposed minimum for New York State workers, is both unlivable and unfair, while some complain of hostile and unsanitary work environment.
lead_paragraph: Citing inadequate pay, discrimination and a bedbug-ridden office, call center workers for Access-A-Ride have filed a class-action lawsuit and threatened to strike.

headline.main: M.T.A. Contract Workers Push for Higher Wages and Better Working Conditions
headline.print_headline: M.T.A. Contract Workers Push for Higher Wages
